review_blob: On tap at Girmaldis pizza-very tasty APA. Nice citrus aroma..hop flavor over the nose, citrus and caramel finish. Definitely one of my favorites far as an American pale ale goes. Will definitely drink more of this...
12oz bottle. Peppery hop flavor-with tones of grapefruit and orange. Nice bitter finish. No disappointments here. Good stuff!

Simply put-I love this beer. I managed to vacation to Ireland in 2010 and of course, toured the Guinness brewery. The perfectly poured pint at the end of the tour was the best Ive ever tasted. The only way one can truly enjoy a Guinness is on draft, of course. The bottle is pathetic and can doesnt represent what a wonderful drink this is Love the caramel, coffee, chocolate, roasty flavor-this is my dark beer of choice.

Not impressed. Grassy pine aroma, biscuit heavy and very little hop flavor. 6.49/six pack at the local grocery. Its a head snapper? Hardly 

This is by far the most watered-down IPA Ive had to date. Tried to give this one the benefit of the doubt(the only saving grace for the money spent is the 6.9% ABV)

22oz single bottle found at local grocer. Pours deep amber in color, floral and citrus aroma. Lacy foam head. Big in what I like to call "real IPA" flavor-love the abundance of hops-the 102 IBU is as advertised. Definitely up there with Sierra Nevada Hoptimum. One of my favorite IPAs Ive had to date. Good stuff!!

Good stuff here. Surprised at the malty/caramel flavor-almost could be mistaken as a barleywine style instead of IPA. Still-plenty of hops and raisin, chocolate and coffee flavors (to name a few!) mingling to make this an outstanding beer.
By far my favorite imperial/double IPA. No disappointment here. Big hop flavor. Love it!
On draft at the local BW3. Served in a tall tulip glass. Foamy two finger head with a grapefruit aroma. Excellent flavor and bitterness. This is my idea of a well balanced IPA.
